functions.description: Displays the website header with logo and main menu options.
Loads the latest simulated exchange rates from a mock data source or API.
Displays an input form for two currency values to be converted, with options for the base and target currencies. This form also includes error handling for invalid inputs/currency types.

Calculates the converted value based on simulated exchange rates and displays results in a user-friendly format. This function also handles scenarios when one or both of the currencies are not available.
Updates the display with the latest conversion result after calculation
Displays information about the website, including purpose and development team. Provides links to additional resources such as FAQ or blog page.

function.description: Gather the project requirements and specifications from stakeholde by conducting meetings, interviews, or surveys. Define the scope of the website, its purpose, target audience, features, user experience, design elements, content types, and any other necessary information.

Design wireframes for each webpage to visualize the layout, structure, and navigation. Focus on the overall architecture of the site and user flow for better communication and understanding of expectations
Decide upon a technology (frontend - React/Angular/Vue, backend - Node.js/Django/Laravel)stack that will be used to build the website. Select appropriate hosting solutions like AWS or Heroku.
Setup a new repository on GitHub for version control and collaboration purposes, including necessary dependencies and libraries.
Plan the content types (text, images, videos), organize the information flow across webpages, define SEO best practices and user-generated contents if needed

function.function: Create Markdown files for each webpage/section of the website, following a standardized structure with headings, subheadings, lists, tables, code blocks, and other format as necessary. Write clear, concise content that matches the project's tone and style.

function.description: Automatically or manually convert Markdown files into valid HTML using available tools like Jekyll themes for Shopstyle or MkDocs, ensuring proper conversion of headings, lists, tables, and code blocks.
Create CSS templates for each webpage to define visual presentation such as fonts, colors, margins, headers, footers, etc. Use a responsive design approach and ensure cross-browser compatibility.
Develop the front end of the website using HTML, CSS and JavaScript libraries like React or Vue based on the chosen tech stack to create interactive components, navigation menus, forms, buttons etc.

function.function: Set up a backend application for managing content
function.description: Develop a back end system (if applicable) using the selected technology stack that works with data storage and retrieval (SQL or NoSQL databases), handles user sessions, authentication and authorization. It should also integrate necessary APIs to fetch dynamic content.

Assign routes in frontend for the generated HTML pages that are based on markdown files. Link each webpage with others, ensuring a smooth user experience across all pages of the website. Optimize images and videos loading times by using techniques like lazy-loading and compression.

Deploy the project on servers (AWS/Heroku etc.) after ensuring that it works properly locally or in a staging environment. Set up necessary configurations for SSL, domain management, traffic limitations and error monitoring.

Optimize the website design by including relevant keywords, optimizing title tags, meta descriptions, using internal links with anchor text etc. Improve load times for faster page loads that are crucial to better SEO results.

Conduct comprehensive testing including unit tests, accessibility tests (WCAG), security vulnerability scans etc. Debug reported bugs or issues during test run, iterate upon the findings and enhance code.
Using tools like Google Analytics to track user behavior, page views, bounce rate, session duration etc. Use these insights to refine layouts and improve website performance over time.
Design an interface for non-technical users to update their site's content without needing HTML knowledge, either through CMS plugins or the creation of specialized user interfaces.

function.function: Run website on a local development environment first
function.description: Before deploying changes live, run your updated code locally and perform necessary tests to ensure it works without any broken links, missing features or unhandled errors before moving forward with updates.

function.description: Displays the company logo and tagline to establish brand recognition.

function.function: Hero Section with Product Introduction Video
function.description: Presents a short video introducing the AI Chatbot product, highlighting its unique features and benefits.
Provides easy access to different sections of the site like 'About Us', 'Features', 'Pricing', 'Testimonials' etc.
Breaks down the features of the AI Chatbot product into standalone sections for ease of understanding.
Visual aids to demonstrate complex concepts and illustrate how each feature works in real-life scenarios.
Narrates the history and expertise of the company in developing AI technology solutions.
Showcases key team members with their roles and contributions to instill trust and establish a personal connection.
Outlines various pricing options based on features, usage levels, and customer segments.
A visual comparison of the cost-benefit analysis between different subscription plans for easy decision making.
Allows realtime conversations with customer service representatives to address queries and offer personalized assistance.
Facilitates direct email communication, ensuring that user inquiries are captured accurately for follow-up responses.

function.function: Create HTML markup for the helloWorld.html file.
function.description: To display 'Hello Word' text on the page, you need to create an HTML document with a <h1> tag containing the text.

function.function: Style the helloWord web page using CSS.
function.description: Use CSS stylesheets or embedding style tags in your HTML markup to give styling to your 'Hello Word' display like changing background colors, fonts etc. You may use inline styles as well for basic styling.
Decide where you want your website hosted and whether you want to buy a domain name or not. There are various providers that offer services like shared web hosting, dedicated servers, etc.

Once the HTML file is ready with your desired CSS styling and you've deployed it to a server or local machine for testing purposes, make sure you navigate properly to see if everything displays as expected.

After the helloWord page goes live, monitor its performance to ensure there are no errors and that it's reaching your target audience. Also consider making improvements or adding more pages overtime based on the user interaction data.
Create a button that navigates the user to the 'helloworld' page when clicked. Ensure it is clearly labeled and accessible.
Show a friendly 'Hello, world!' message when the user lands on the page.

17:
The following batch program can be used to read the dataset named "Gamedata.xlsx" and create a logistic model of it:
```batch
@echo off
SETLOCAL EnableDelayedExpansion
set input_file=Gamedata.xlsx
set output_file=Logistic.xlsx
REM Read and manipulate the data using Excel to run Logistic Regression Model. 
PowerShell -Command "& 'import-module excel; open '%input_file%' as $xl | select *,*[2] into $new (a); save ($xls,'%output_file%)'; close($xl)"
REM Summary will be stored in the output file created above.

:EndOfFile
echo Logistic regression model created and summaries logged in "%output_file%" file.
ENDLOCAL
```
Here’s a natural language function checklist from users views: 
1. Read dataset "Gamedata.xlsx" with the logistics regression software or add-ins like Excel, R etc to create Logistic Regression Model. (Depends on Software/Language that user prefer)
2. Select necessary columns as independent and one dependent variable column named 'result'. And make sure result is lagged by one period.
3. Run the logistic regression model with selected data columns to predict future outcomes of the dependent variable, "result". (Depends on software/language preferred).
4. Log summaries like significant variables, coefficients values or p-values etc in a new file created named as “Logistics.xlsx”. 
Note: These steps might differ depending upon user's need and his data exploration journey before fitting model to his dataset.

function.description: Ensure that the 'Deathlist.csv' file exists and can be accessed by the batch program.
Read all rows from the 'Deathlist.csv', starting from the second column (assuming the first is a header).
Parse each row to extract the 'Date of death' and associated deaths count.
Create groups based on weeks from the extracted dates, summing up associated death counts for each period.
Organize histogram data with week periods and corresponding deaths count to be able to display.
Print the hitstogram in a visual representation showing weekly intervals and number of deaths, possibly using ASCII characters or similar representations in command prompt output.
